goals__remit:
Klima-Bündnis Lëtzebuerg is a network of luxembourgish municipalities committed to the goals of the international Climate Alliance. Since the foundation of this international association in 1990, more than 1,700 cities, municipalities and districts have joined the "Climate Alliance of European Cities with Indigenous Rainforest Peoples". In Luxembourg, 37 municipalities are member of Klima-Bündnis Lëtzebuerg. 
  
The member cities and municipalities aim for the reduction of greenhouse emissions. For achieving this goal local climate strategies are developed and implemented, especially in the energy and transport sectors. Furthermore there are measures to raise the publics awareness for the protection of the rainforest and to abstain in municipal procurement from tropical timber derived from destructive logging.
